i.b: San Marino High School Honored as a California Distinguished School. Click to read more...

section.p:
Our San Marino Schools Foundation is currently running its "We Are San Marino" donation drive campaign to help us save 20 vital teacher and counselor positions by May 12, 2020.
Time is of the essence. Please help us help our students maintain access to important programs and services that will ensure they become the leaders our world needs.
The link above is a message from our Superintendent Dr. Jeff Wilson that provides additional details on why we need your support and why we need it now.
Please click here for updates, student and parent resources, and more information related to student dismissal.

h1.a: Sign-up or Verify your E-mail for District Communications

section.p: The District uses Constant Contact to distribute information via e-mail. Sign-up or verify your e-mail address.

San Marino Unified School District is closely monitoring the novel coronavirus to provide you updates with the latest information. We advise parents to not send your child to school if they may be sick. Click to see guidelines, resources, and updates on flu and coronavirus.

h1.a: San Marino High WASC Self-Study Report Highlights

section.p: The Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC) Visiting Committee commended San Marino High School and its students, teachers, staff, parents, community members and administrators for the successful completion of its accreditation visit on Feb. 26, 2020. The WASC Committee concluded that SMHS met the five expectations of the WASC self-study and confirmed that evidence supported achievement based on schoolwide student goals and academic standards.
Superintendent Dr. Jeff Wilson was invited to speak at a recent San Marino City Club meeting to provide a State of the District address. Click the link above to see the presentation.

h1.a: San Marino Unified School District Receives $100,000 Donation

section.p: A generous $100,000 donation was presented to the San Marino Unified School District (SMUSD) by the PT Affiliates at the District’s school board meeting. Just in time for the holidays, the donation will be allocated for professional development for teachers.
The San Marino Unified School District is looking for feedback from the community. To gather your feedback, we're using a tool called Thoughtexchange. All of our voices matter, so please participate.

The Superintendent formed a task force entitled the “Fiscal Resources Strategic Team” or FiRST to advise him on the District’s fiscal resources and any potential revenue enhancement options and opportunities.
The SMUSD Mobile App features news, calendars, push notifications, and much more! Available in app stores now.
